Is there anything else that you'd like to share or you feel is important for us to know before we finish?

British people are very, you know, what to call this one? Embracing. It's not that, it's not, I don't feel they say there is, there is like, they call it different individuality.
They have different individuality, but to British people to embrace different, different culture and different, different nationality coming here and they are being accommodative to the people here like me that I'm able to study here, to work here, to live here.
You know, it's one thing that I have a big, huge respect with the British people that they are not closing their doors. Even, even, even some of the government is crying, but still they are very lenient and they're very open, open arms, you know, welcoming people who wants to leave here decently to look for a better future.
And that's one thing I'm very grateful and thankful that I'm able to live here. Even so, circumstances that change, but that one thing that I want, I want people to understand that British people are, are, what to call this one?
British people are blessed to have this country as their own and maybe, maybe they don't see that one, but me as a, coming from a third world country, it's, it's a privilege to, to, to be here and to, to have the same right that you cannot have in the other country.
And that's one thing that I am truly blessed and truly thankful, grateful for that opportunity to live in this country, you know, to be able to be, to be able to be a citizen here and to be able to, to become a part of this country is something that I would be grateful for, for all my life.
Me and my daughter being protected in this country, I know that we're protected here. I know that the law here, they serve the law here and they protect the law here. It's one thing that I can sleep peacefully in the night.
I thought before I couldn't do that one, because I said, oh, this is other country, they maybe protect their own kin, but no, it's, I'm the, I'm the, I'm the living proof for myself that I could speak to that.
British people are blessed to have this country as itself for them. So I'm really honored and glad that I'm able to stay in this country legally, you know, and they got me to stay here with my daughter legally.
Not all, not all are, are, are given the chance, but I, I, I am the one of them that was given the chance and I'm thankful and privileged for that. Yeah.
